org.jruyi.io

Interface IBuffer

  • All Superinterfaces:
    java.lang.AutoCloseable, java.lang.Comparable<IBuffer>, IByteSequence, ICloseable, IDumpable

    public interface IBuffer
extends java.lang.Comparable<IBuffer>, IByteSequence, IDumpable, ICloseable
    A byte buffer, which contains a linear, finite sequence of bytes and has the following properties: size, position and mark.
    • size is the number of bytes that the underlying buffer contains. It is never negative.
    • position is the index of the next byte to be read. It is never negative and is never greater than size.
    • mark is the index to which position will be reset when the method reset is invoked. It is never negative and is never greater than position. Its initial value is 0.

    A IBuffer cannot be used anymore after it's closed. Otherwise, the behavior is undefined.

    See Also:
    IBufferFactory, IUnit, IUnitChain

      • skip

        int skip(int n)
        Skips over the next Math.min(n, remaining()) bytes. If n is negative, no bytes are skipped.

        If m is the actual number of bytes are skipped, then position is incremented by m.

        Parameters:
        n - the number of bytes to be skipped
        Returns:
        the actual number of bytes skipped

        void mark()
        Sets mark to the current position

        Returns:

      • indexOf

        int indexOf(byte b)
        Returns the index of the first occurrence of the specified byte b in this byte sequence. If no such byte occurs in this byte sequence, then -1 is returned.

        This method behaves exactly as below. 

         indexOf(b, 0)
        Parameters:
        b - the byte whose index of the first occurrence is to be returned
        Returns:
        the index of the first occurrence of the given b in this byte sequence, -1 if the byte does not occur

      • indexOf

        int indexOf(byte b,
            int fromIndex)
        Returns the index of the first occurrence of the specified byte b in this byte sequence, starting search at the given fromIndex. If no such byte occurs after index fromIndex(inclusive) in this byte sequence, then -1 is returned.

        There is no restriction on the value of fromIndex. If it is negative, it has the same effect as if it were 0. If it's greater than or equal to the length of this byte sequence, then -1 is returned.

        Parameters:
        b - the byte whose index of the first occurrence is to be returned
        fromIndex - the index to start the search from
        Returns:
        the index of the first occurrence of the given b after fromIndex(inclusive) in this byte sequence, - 1 if the byte does not occur

      • indexOf

        int indexOf(byte[] bytes)
        Returns the index of the first occurrence of the specified bytes in this byte sequence. If no such byte array occurs, then -1 is returned.

        This method behaves exactly as below. 

         indexOf(bytes, 0)
        Parameters:
        bytes - the target byte array
        Returns:
        the index of the first occurrence of the given bytes in this byte sequence, -1 if the target byte array does not occur

      • indexOf

        int indexOf(byte[] bytes,
            int fromIndex)
        Returns the index of the first occurrence of the specified bytes in this byte sequence, starting search at the given fromIndex. If no such byte array occurs, then -1 is returned.

        There is no restriction on the value of fromIndex. If it is negative, it has the same effect as if it were 0. If it's greater than or equal to the length of this byte sequence, then -1 is returned.

        Parameters:
        bytes - the target byte array
        fromIndex - the index to start the search from
        Returns:
        the index of the first occurrence of the given bytes after fromIndex(inclusive) in this byte sequence, -1 if the target byte array does not occur

      • indexOf

        int indexOf(ByteKmp pattern)
        Returns the index within this sequence of the first occurrence of the specified pattern. If no such subsequence exists, then -1 is returned.
        Parameters:
        pattern - the KMP pattern holding the subsequence for which to search
        Returns:
        if the given pattern occurs as a subsequence within this sequence, then the index of the first character of the first such subsequence is returned; if it does not occur as a subsequence, - 1 is returned
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if pattern is null

      • indexOf

        int indexOf(ByteKmp pattern,
            int fromIndex)
        Returns the index within this sequence of the first occurrence of the specified pattern, starting at the specified fromIndex. If no such subsequence exists, then -1 is returned.
        Parameters:
        pattern - the KMP pattern holding the subsequence for which to search
        fromIndex - the index from which to start the search
        Returns:
        if the given pattern occurs as a subsequence within this sequence, then the index of the first character of the first such subsequence is returned; if it does not occur as a subsequence, - 1 is returned
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if pattern is null

      • lastIndexOf

        int lastIndexOf(byte b)
        Returns the index of the last occurrence of the specified byte b in this byte sequence, searching backward starting at (length() - 1). If no such byte occurs, then -1 is returned.

        This method behaves exactly as below. 

         lastIndexOf(b, length() - 1)
        Parameters:
        b - the byte whose index of the last occurrence is to be returned
        Returns:
        the index of the last occurrence of the given b in this byte sequence, -1 if the byte does not occur

      • lastIndexOf

        int lastIndexOf(byte b,
                int fromIndex)
        Returns the index of the last occurrence of the specified byte b in this byte sequence, searching backward starting at the specified fromIndex. If no such byte occurs before index fromIndex (inclusive) in this byte sequence, then -1 is returned.

        There is no restriction on the value of fromIndex. If it is greater than or equal to the length of this byte sequence, then the entire byte sequence would be searched. If it is negative, then it has the same effect as if it were -1: -1 is returned.

        Parameters:
        b - the byte whose index of the last occurrence is to be returned
        fromIndex - the index to start the backward search from
        Returns:
        the index of the last occurrence of the given b before fromIndex(inclusive) in this byte sequence, -1 if the byte does not occur

      • lastIndexOf

        int lastIndexOf(byte[] bytes)
        Returns the index of the last occurrence of the specified byte array bytes in this byte sequence, searching backward starting at (length() - bytes.length). If no such byte array occurs, then -1 is returned.
        Parameters:
        bytes - the byte array whose index of the last occurrence is to be returned
        Returns:
        the index of the last occurrence of the given bytes in this byte sequence, -1 if the given byte sequence does not occur

      • lastIndexOf

        int lastIndexOf(byte[] bytes,
                int fromIndex)
        Returns the index of the last occurrence of the specified byte array bytes in this byte sequence, searching backward starting at the specified fromIndex. If no such byte sequence occurs before index fromIndex(inclusive) in this byte sequence, then -1 is returned.
        Parameters:
        bytes - the byte sequence whose index of the last occurrence is to be returned
        fromIndex - the index to start the backward search from
        Returns:
        the index of the last occurrence of the given bytes before fromIndex(inclusive) in this byte sequence, -1 if the given byte sequence does not occur

      • lastIndexOf

        int lastIndexOf(ByteKmp pattern)
        Returns the index within this sequence of the rightmost occurrence of the specified subsequence by searching with the KMP algorithm.
        Parameters:
        pattern - the subsequence to search for
        Returns:
        if the given pattern occurs one or more times as a subsequence within this object, then the index of the first character of the last such subsequence is returned. If it does not occur as a subsequence, -1 is returned.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if pattern is null

      • lastIndexOf

        int lastIndexOf(ByteKmp pattern,
                int fromIndex)
        Returns the index of the last occurrence of the specified pattern in this byte sequence, searching backward starting at the specified fromIndex using the KMP algorithm. If no such byte sequence occurs in this byte sequence, then -1 is returned.
        Parameters:
        pattern - the subsequence to search for
        fromIndex - the index to start the backward search from
        Returns:
        the index of the last occurrence of the given pattern, -1 if the given subsequence does not occur
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if pattern is null

      • compact

        IBuffer compact()
        Compacts this buffer by dropping all the data before the current position.

        This buffer's position is set to zero. Its size is set to remaining(). And its mark is discarded if defined.

        Returns:
        this buffer

      • newBuffer

        IBuffer newBuffer()
        Creates a new empty buffer using the same buffer factory instance that created this buffer.
        Returns:
        a new empty buffer

      • split

        IBuffer split(int size)
        Splits this buffer into two pieces and returns the first piece. This buffer holds the rest second piece. The two pieces may share some data, which means that changes to the content of one of them may be visible to another one, though they have independent position, size and mark value. So better use them as readonly.
        Parameters:
        size - number of bytes of the first piece
        Returns:
        the first piece
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if size is negative or greater than IByteSequence.length()

      • setLength

        IBuffer setLength(int newLength)
        Adjusts the length of the buffer to the specified newLength. If newLength is greater than the current length, then the last newLength - length() bytes will be filled with zeroes. If newLength is smaller than the current length, then the last length() - newLength bytes will be dropped.

        If the buffer's position is larger than newLength, then it is set to newLength. If the buffer's mark is larger than newLength, then it is discarded.

        Parameters:
        newLength - the new length of the buffer to be adjusted to
        Returns:
        this buffer
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if newLength is negative

      • drain

        void drain()
        Empties this buffer.

      • drainTo

        void drainTo(IBuffer dst)
        Writes all the remaining data into the end of the given dst. Then empties this buffer.
        Parameters:
        dst - the buffer where the data to be transfered to
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if dst is null
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if dst is this buffer

      • reserveHead

        int reserveHead(int size)
        Reserves the given size bytes in the head of the buffer for the efficiency of prepending data. The actual effective reserved size is returned and may be smaller.
        Parameters:
        size - the number of bytes to be reserved in the head
        Returns:
        the actual effective size that has been reserved

      • headReserved

        int headReserved()
        Returns the number of bytes currently reserved for head.
        Returns:
        the current number of bytes reserved for head

        int readIn(java.nio.channels.ReadableByteChannel in)
    throws java.io.IOException
        Writes the data read from the specified channel in to this buffer.
        Parameters:
        in - the channel to read
        Returns:
        the number of bytes read, possibly zero
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an I/O error occur

        int writeOut(java.nio.channels.WritableByteChannel out)
      throws java.io.IOException

        Parameters:
        out - the channel to write
        Returns:
        the number of bytes written, possibly zero
        Throws:

      • writeFill

        IBuffer writeFill(byte b,
                  int count)
        Writes count b values into the underlying buffer. The size is incremented by count.
        Parameters:
        b - the byte value to write
        count - the number of b values to write
        Returns:
        this buffer
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if count is negative

      • setFill

        IBuffer setFill(int index,
                byte b,
                int count)
        Sets all count bytes starting at the specified start to the specified byte b.
        Parameters:
        index - the offset of the first byte to be set
        b - the byte to set
        count - the number of bytes to be set
        Returns:
        this buffer
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - if start is negative or not smaller than the underlying buffer's size, minus count - 1, or count is negative

      • prependFill

        IBuffer prependFill(byte b,
                    int count)
        Writes count b values to the head of the underlying buffer. The size is incremented by count.
        Parameters:
        b - the byte to write
        count - the number of b values to write
        Returns:
        this buffer
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if count is negative

      • getUnsignedByte

        int getUnsignedByte(int index)
        Zero-extends the byte value at the specified index to type int and returns the result, which is therefore in the range 0 through 255.

        This method behaves exactly the same way as: 

          byteAt(index) & 0xFF
        Parameters:
        index - the index of the byte value
        Returns:
        the byte at the specified index, interpreted as an unsigned 8-bit value
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - if index < 0 or index >= length()

      • getUnsignedShort

        int getUnsignedShort(int index,
                     IShortCodec codec)
        Uses the specified codec to decode the bytes starting from the specified index as an int value, in the range 0 through 65535 and returns the result.

        This method behaves exactly the same way as: 

          get(index, codec) & 0xFFFF
        Parameters:
        index - the starting index of the bytes to be decoded
        codec - the codec to decode
        Returns:
        the decoded unsigned 16-bit value
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - if the specified index is out of bounds

      • readUnsignedByte

        int readUnsignedByte()
        Returns the next byte from the underlying buffer as an unsigned 8-bit value. position is incremented by 1.

        This method behaves exactly the same way as: 

          read() & 0xFF
        Returns:
        the next byte read as an unsigned 8-bit value
        Throws:
        java.nio.BufferUnderflowException - if there are no bytes remaining in the underlying buffer

      • readUnsignedShort

        int readUnsignedShort(IShortCodec codec)
        Uses the specified codec to decode the bytes starting at the current position from the underlying buffer into an unsigned 16-bit int value and returns the result.

        This method behaves exactly the same way as: 

          read(codec) & 0xFFFF
        Parameters:
        codec - the codec to decode
        Returns:
        the decoded result
        Throws:
        java.nio.BufferUnderflowException - if there are not enough remaining bytes to decode

         ICharCodec codec)

        codec - the codec to decode
        Returns:
        the resultant char value
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - if the specified index is out of bounds

             T dst,
             int offset,
             int length,
             ICodec<T> codec)

        <T> T read(int length,
           ICodec<T> codec)
        Uses the specified codec to decode the bytes, starting at position and ending at (position() + length), from the underlying buffer into an object of type T and returns the resultant object.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of the result to decode to
        Parameters:
        length - the number bytes to be decoded
        codec - the codec to decode
        Returns:
        the resultant object of type T
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the given length is negative
        java.nio.BufferUnderflowException - if there are not enough bytes remained in the underlying buffer

      • read

        <T> int read(T dst,
             ICodec<T> codec)
        Uses the specified codec to decode the bytes, starting at position, from the underlying buffer into the specified dst and returns the actual number of bytes decoded.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of the result to decode to
        Parameters:
        dst - the object to hold the decoded result
        codec - the codec to decode
        Returns:
        the actual number of bytes decoded

      • read

        <T> int read(T dst,
             int offset,
             int length,
             ICodec<T> codec)
        Uses the specified codec to decode the bytes, starting at position, from the underlying buffer into the specified dst starting from offset(inclusive) to (offset + length)(exclusive) and returns the actual number of bytes decoded.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of the result to decode to
        Parameters:
        dst - the object to hold the decoded result
        offset - the start index of the destination
        length - the capacity of the destination
        codec - the codec to decode
        Returns:
        the actual number of bytes decoded
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - if offset or length doesn't hold the condition

      • getOutputStream

        java.io.OutputStream getOutputStream()
        Returns an OutputStream object that represents this buffer. Operations made on either one of them will be reflected in another one.
        Returns:
        an OutputStream object that represents this buffer

      • getInputStream

        java.io.InputStream getInputStream()
        Returns an InputStream object that represents this buffer. Operations made on either one of them will be reflected in another one.
        Returns:
        an InputStream object that represents this buffer

      • slice

        IBuffer slice()
        Creates a new buffer that shares this buffer's content.

        The content of the new buffer will start at this buffer's current position. Changes to this buffer's content may be visible in the new buffer, and vice versa. The two buffers' size, position and mark values will be independent.

        The new buffer's position will be zero, its size will be the number of bytes remaining in this buffer, and its mark will be undefined.

        Returns:
        the new buffer
        Since:
        2.2

      • duplicate

        IBuffer duplicate()
        Creates a new buffer that shares this buffer's content.

        The content of the new buffer will be the same as this buffer. Changes to this buffer's content may be visible in the new buffer, and vice versa. The two buffers' size, position and mark values will be independent.

        The new buffer's size, position and mark values will be identical to those of this buffer.

        Returns:
        the new buffer
        Since:
        2.2
